title: Why does the moon look larger when it's on the horizon?
summary: The moon looks enormous when it's near the horizon — why is that?

title: 2,500 years ago, people in Bulgaria ate dog meat at feasts and as a delicacy, archaeological study finds
summary: A study of dog bones across several Iron Age sites in Bulgaria has shown that people ate dog meat.

title: 480,000-year-old ax sharpener is the oldest known elephant bone tool ever discovered in Europe
summary: The "very rare" find provides an extraordinary glimpse into the ingenuity of early human relatives who lived around half a million years ago.

title: Astronomers discover a gigantic, wobbling black hole jet that 'changes the way we think about the galaxy'
summary: Combining observations from several powerful telescopes, astronomers have detected a gargantuan, 'wobbling' black hole outburst that's as wide as an entire galaxy.

title: Some of the oldest harpoons ever found reveal Indigenous people in Brazil were hunting whales 5,000 years ago
summary: The origins of whaling are highly debated. Now, some of the earliest signs of active whale hunting have appeared somewhere unexpected: southern Brazil.

title: 'A real revolution': The James Webb telescope is upending our understanding of the biggest, oldest black holes in the universe
summary: For years, the James Webb Space Telescope has been spotting enormous black holes in the early universe that defy all expectations. Now, astronomers are finally deciphering the origins of these cosmic behemoths.

title: Chocolate Hills: The color-changing mounds in the Philippines that inspired legends of mud-slinging giants
summary: The Chocolate Hills are 1,776 mounds on Bohol Island in the Philippines where grassy cover turns brown during the dry season.

title: An ocean the size of the Arctic once covered half of Mars, new images hint
summary: Mars may have been a "blue planet" with an ocean the size of today's Arctic Ocean, a new study suggests.

title: 5,500-year-old human skeleton discovered in Colombia holds the oldest evidence yet that syphilis came from the Americas
summary: An ancient DNA analysis of a 5,500-year-old human skeleton reveals that an ancestor of the bacterium that causes syphilis was present in the Americas at least 3,000 years earlier than previously thought.

title: Californians have been using far less water than suppliers estimated — what does this mean for the state?
summary: Flawed assumptions about water demand mean suppliers in California overestimated future demand by an average of 74% over 20 years — positive news for the drought-embattled state.

title: Scientists may be approaching a 'fundamental breakthrough in cosmology and particle physics' — if dark matter and 'ghost particles' can interact
summary: Astronomers found evidence that dark matter and neutrinos may interact, hinting at a "fundamental breakthrough" that challenges our understanding of how the universe evolved.

title: 2,400-year-old Hercules shrine and elite tombs discovered outside ancient Rome's walls
summary: Archaeologists have unearthed tombs and a shrine dedicated to Hercules from the time of the Roman Republic.

title: Coyote scrambles onto Alcatraz Island after perilous, never-before-seen swim
summary: Experts have reacted to a viral video of a coyote swimming to Alcatraz Island in what is a surprising first for the San Francisco Bay Area.

title: Stunning time-lapse video captured using 'artificial eclipse' shows 3 massive eruptions on the sun
summary: ESA's Proba-3 mission, made up of twin spacecraft capable of aligning to create artificial eclipses, has captured "rare" footage of three solar prominences erupting from the sun's mysteriously hot atmosphere.

title: Enormous freshwater reservoir discovered off the East Coast may be 20,000 years old and big enough to supply NYC for 800 years
summary: An expedition off the coast of Massachusetts has confirmed the existence of a freshwater reservoir beneath the seafloor. Now, scientists are starting to understand when and how it formed.

title: World's oldest known rock art predates modern humans' entrance into Europe — and it was found in an Indonesian cave
summary: The hand stencil is more than 1,000 years older than the previous earliest evidence of rock art.

title: 2.6 million-year-old jaw from extinct 'Nutcracker Man' is found where we didn't expect it
summary: A fossil jaw of a distant human relative was discovered much farther north than previously thought possible, revealing new information about diversity in human evolution.

title: Earth hit by biggest 'solar radiation storm' in 23 years, triggering Northern Lights as far as Southern California
summary: Earth's magnetic field was struck by a "severe" solar storm Monday (Jan. 19), triggering vibrant auroras in the U.S. and large parts of Europe. The storm broke a record that had stood for more than two decades.

title: Giant underwater plumes triggered by 7-story waves at Nazaré captured off Portuguese coast — Earth from space
summary: A 2020 satellite photo shows the immense power of 7-story waves crashing along the Portuguese coast. Later the same day, a surfer rode a 101-foot-tall wave at Nazaré, setting a new world record.

title: Ever watched a pet cow pick up a broom and scratch herself with it? You have now
summary: A pet cow in Austria started using a broom to scratch herself — the first ever documented case of bovine tool use.

title: Eerie 'sand burials' of elite Anglo-Saxons and their 'sacrificed' horse discovered near UK nuclear power plant
summary: The 1,400 year-old "sand burials" of two people and a horse were found near a nuclear power plant construction site in the U.K.

title: سباق مع الزمن.. عشرات طُمروا تحت "جبل نفايات" في الفلبين
summary: يواصل عناصر الإنقاذ، السبت، مستخدمين الجرافات عمليات البحث عن ناجين بين أكوام القمامة عقب انهيار مكب نفايات في وسط الفلبين، مما أدى إلى دفن عشرات من عمال النظافة ومقتل ستة منهم على الأقل.

title: رهان على مصير مادورو.. شخص مجهول عرف قبل الجميع
summary: حقق مقامر أرباحا تقارب نصف مليون دولار من رهانٍ على اعتقال الرئيس الفنزويلي نيكولاس مادورو، قبل الإعلان الرسمي عن العملية، ما أثار تساؤلات حول احتمال استفادة جهات من معلومات داخلية تتعلق بالتحرك الأميركي.
